qas.question: Who described an interaction between Jesus on the cross and women?
What did Jesus say to women in the crowd?
Where are the words found in the Gospel?
What was the ground like where Jesus was crucified?
What did the women gather to keep themselves warm?
What color did some women in Jerusalem like to wear?
What did Jesus do when he felt sorrow for Jerusalem?
What high area is usually green when new grass grows?

context: <a0_0>Luke's gospel<a0_0/> also describes an interaction between Jesus and the women among the <a3_0>crowd of mourners<a3_0/> following him, quoting Jesus as saying "Daughters of Jerusalem, <a1_0>do not <b7_0>weep<b7_0/> for me<a1_0/>, but weep for yourselves and for your children. For behold, the days are coming when they will say, 'Blessed are the barren and the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!' Then they will begin to say to the mountains, 'Fall on us,' and to the <b8_0>hills<b8_0/>, 'Cover us.' For if they do these things when the <b5_0>wood<b5_0/> is <b6_0>green<b6_0/>, what will happen when it is <b4_0>dry<b4_0/>?"[<a2_0>Lk. 23:28-31<a2_0/>]
